intro: Psyllothamnus, commonly known as the golden bush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rutaceae. It is native to Australia and consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees. The plants are characterized by their aromatic leaves and showy yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring. They typically grow in dry, sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Psyllothamnus species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and drought tolerance.
